<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 305, 220, 320]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 326, 358, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 415, 390, 433]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 446, 787, 463]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 463, 325, 478]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 478, 504, 494]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 494, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 509, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 585, 593, 600]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 600, 606, 616]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 630, 609, 646]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 645, 757, 661]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 660, 440, 676]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 767, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(|x + a| = |2x - 5a|\), giving \(x\) in terms of the positive constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 510, 141, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 520, 905, 540]]<|/det|>
Use logarithms to solve the equation \(3^{x + 4} = 5^{2x}\), giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 537, 920, 556]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 73, 648, 92]]<|/det|>
By sketching a suitable pair of graphs, show that the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 98, 551, 118]]<|/det|>
\[x^{3} = 11 - 2x\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 126, 361, 144]]<|/det|>
has exactly one real root.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 126, 920, 144]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 485, 191, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 485, 358, 504]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 504, 579, 526]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \sqrt[3]{(11 - 2x_n)}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 528, 920, 564]]<|/det|>
to find the root correct to 4 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 6 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 543, 920, 562]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve \(y = \frac{\mathrm{e}^{4x}}{2x + 3}\) at the point on the curve for which \(x = 0\). Give your answer in the form \(ax + by + c = 0\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 102, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 85, 650, 273]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 291, 920, 355]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(y = \frac{K}{a^{2x}}\), where \(K\) and \(a\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(x\) is a straight line passing through the points (0.6, 1.81) and (1.4, 1.39), as shown in the diagram. Find the values of \(K\) and \(a\) correct to 2 significant figures. [6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 74, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 73, 725, 92]]<|/det|>
Use the factor theorem to show that \((x + 2)\) is a factor of the expression

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 100, 589, 119]]<|/det|>
\[6x^{3} + 13x^{2} - 33x - 70\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 127, 532, 146]]<|/det|>
and hence factorise the expression completely.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 127, 920, 146]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
